title: Understanding the Central Limit Theorem
text: The central limit theorem is a fundamental concept in statistics. It states that the distribution of sample means will tend to be normal, or Gaussian, as the sample size increases, regardless of the shape of the population distribution.

title: Sample Size and Distribution
text: Consider how increasing the sample size affects the distribution of sample means. Does it become more or less like a Gaussian distribution?

title: Analyzing the Distribution
text: As the sample size increases, the distribution of sample means becomes more like which type of distribution?
